page.title: 07LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: a tower, and Hildersham Church.Other notable buildings are Hildersham Hall, Abington Hall (now the world famous Welding Institute), Abington Lodge which houses the local riding stables as well as being a family property, and an old windmill. The building style is very mixed including some old thatched cottages and some modern estates, built since 1955. Some older buildings have been updated - for example,the local village shop. Little Linton consists largely of a modern housing estate. There are two schools, the primary school in Great Abington and Linton Village College. There are the remains of a flintstone wall by the High Street, together with all the modern additions - telephone boxes, telegraph poles, litter bins, street lights, bus shelters, post boxes, etc. all part of our modern scene.
